original: Barnekow, Christian Fredrik, friherre, överstelöjtnant, Göteborg, f. 5/ 3/99’ i V. Sallerup, Malmöh. 1., av frih. Adolf B. o. frihran Eva Wrede. G. 25 m. Brita Piper. Barn: Caroline f. 26, Marianne 28, Rutger 35. — Stud:ex. 16, off:ex. 19, AIHSak 21-22, AIHShk 24-26. Fänr. v. Wendes artrreg. 19, löjtn. 22, kapten v. art:-stab. 33, v. Bodens art :reg. 38, major v. Svea art:reg. 40, överstelöjtn. v. Göta art:reg. fr. 44. Repetitör v. AIHS 26-28, adjut. v. artrinsp. 31-37, adjut. h. H. M. Konungen 40. RSO.
translated: Barnekow, Christian Fredrik, Baron, Lieutenant Colonel, Gothenburg, born on March 5, 1899 in V. Sallerup, Malmöhus County, son of Baron Adolf B. and Baroness Eva Wrede. Married to Brita Piper in 1925. Children: Caroline born in 1926, Marianne in 1928, Rutger in 1935. He passed his matriculation exam in 1916, graduated from the Military Academy in 1919, and attended the Artillery and Engineering University from 1921 to 1922, and the Artillery and Engineering College from 1924 to 1926. He was a second lieutenant in von Wendes Artillery Regiment in 1919, a lieutenant in 1922, a captain in the artillery staff in 1933, a major in Svea Artillery Regiment in 1940, and a lieutenant colonel in Göta Artillery Regiment from 1944 onwards. He was a tutor at the Artillery and Engineering College from 1926 to 1928, an adjutant at the Artillery Inspectorate from 1931 to 1937, and an adjutant to His Majesty the King in 1940. Awarded with the Royal Order of the Sword.
